recipe.title: How to Make Onigiri
recipe.intro: Onigiri is a Japanese rice ball. It is easy to make and great for lunch.
recipe.ingredients: cooked rice, salt, nori, tuna, mayonnaise, umeboshi, salmon
steps: **Mix** tuna and mayonnaise in a small bowl.
**Wet** your hands with water and put some salt on them.
**Put** warm rice on your hand and make a small hole in the middle.
**Put** the tuna, umeboshi, or salmon in the hole.
**Close** the rice and press it into a triangle shape with your hands.
**Wrap** the onigiri with nori and put it on a plate. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited Bondi Morning CafÃ© last Saturday. It was right next to Bondi Beach. I sat outside and watched the beautiful ocean. The waves were blue and white. I had salmon onigiri and green tea. The onigiri was fresh and delicious. The cafÃ© was small and cozy with light pink walls. There were pretty flowers on every table. It was a wonderful morning.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: What is that? It looks interesting!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: This is onigiri. It is a Japanese rice ball.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: This one has tuna. That one has salmon.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Can I try the salmon one?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you! It is easy to make.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Can you teach me how to make it?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Of course! You need rice, salt, nori, and a filling.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: It is the black sheet around the rice. It is seaweed.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Oh, I see! I want to try making it at home.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Let's make onigiri together this weekend!
